item.description:
Hi Folks,

I'm interested in practicing top rope climbing at the Quincy Quarries on Saturday morning. I would like to set up a few top ropes from easy to hard. While I have enough gear to set up two ropes, I'm hoping others can bring additional gear. If we have enough ropes, I would like to set up one to practice ascending with jumars or prussiks. If no one brings additional gear, then the size of the event will have to be reduced.

You should have some top rope experience. If you do not, you should try to get instruction at one of the local rock gyms, usually around $50. If you had instruction and are rusty, just let me know so I can be backup belayer. You will also need gear: harness, locking caribiner, belay device (GriGri preferred), climbing shoes, helmet, food, water, DEET bug spray, sunblock, and sunglasses. If you have a rope and anchor gear, please bring it.

We will meet up at the H wall where I will be setting up one of my ropes. This is a nice wall because it has a range of climbing from low 5's to 5.9. There is an online map of the quarries at the Boston Rocks book web site (http://bostonrocksonl....

If the weather is wet, we won't be climbing. I will send out a confirmation email the day or two before.

Driving Directions:

From Boston, take I-93 south to Exit 8 (Furnace Brook Parkway/Quincy). Turn right at Ricciuti Drive. Go up the hill for 0.2 miles and turn right into the big parking lot.

You can also take public transportation. Take the Red Line to Quincy Center. Then, take bus
#215 to Copeland and Willard Streets, walk on Willard Street, go under I-93, then turn right onto Ricciuti Drive. Walk up the hill for 0.2 miles, and turn right into the parking lot.

Ken
item.name: Climbing at Quincy Quarries
